TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP citizen , born in DATE , and living in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their agent PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

According to the applicant , he lodged a constitutional complaint on DATE against ORG ( PERSON ) judgment of DATE , upholding the first instance judgment by which the applicant had been convicted of war crimes against the civilian population . At that time he was serving his sentence in the PERSON prison . The applicant complained about the fairness of the proceedings alleging that the lower courts erroneously assessed the facts of the case and that the rules of procedure were violated .
According to the Government , the applicant ’s constitutional complaint was lodged on DATE .
ORG ) did not acknowledge receipt of the applicant ’s complaint .
On DATE and DATE the applicant asked ORG to speed up the proceedings . His letters were sent from the PERSON prison and the address of the PERSON prison was indicated on the letters .
By decree of the President of GPE of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant was amnestied from serving the rest of his sentence and released from prison .

As , meanwhile , due to his conviction for war crimes , the applicant and his family had lost a specially protected tenancy on a flat in GPE they previously occupied , they moved to the village of GPE , GPE .
According to the applicant , he notified the PERSON prison authorities of his new address in PERSON , as well as of his telephone number there .

According to the ORG the applicant failed to notify either ORG or the PERSON prison authorities about his new address in PERSON . In support of this fact the Government submit a copy of the applicant ’s prisoner ’s card where the only indicated address is the one in PERSON and no further changes were entered .
It is undisputed between the parties that the applicant did not notify ORG of his new address .

The Government submit further that on DATE ORG requested the applicant to submit a copy of the contested judgment . The letter was sent to the PERSON prison . However , the PERSON prison authorities returned the letter stating that the applicant had been released from prison and was living at the address in PERSON .

According to the Government the Constitutional Court ’s above request was sent to the applicant at the PERSON address on DATE . It was , however , returned to the court stating that the applicant was no longer living there . On DATE another unsuccessful attempt was made to deliver ORG letter to the applicant at the same address .
On DATE the court placed the letter to the applicant on its public notice - board , where it stayed posted until DATE .

On DATE ORG terminated the proceedings concerning the applicant ’s constitutional complaint . It stated that the applicant had failed to submit a copy of the contested judgment and that the letters subsequently sent to the applicant were returned to the ORG stating that the applicant did not live at the address indicated . The court deemed that the applicant had withdrawn his complaint .
On DATE the applicant asked ORG once more to speed up the proceedings concerning his constitutional complaint , indicating his address in GPE .
On DATE ORG sent a letter to the applicant informing him that the proceedings had been terminated .

On DATE the applicant lodged a request to have his case restored , although in respect of the proceedings before the ORG such possibility does not exist under NORP law . On DATE he asked ORG to reply to his request . He has received no answer .
The relevant provisions of the Rules of the Constitutional Court ( PERSON Gazette CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) provide as follows :

Section CARDINAL provides that when a party ’s written submissions to the court do not contain the information the court needs it must instruct the party concerned to submit such information within a certain time . If the party fails to comply with the court ’s instructions , the court will deem that party to have withdrawn its submissions .
Section CARDINAL provides that when it is not possible to serve letters or decisions of the court on a party , they shall be placed on the court ’s public notice - board .
Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that when lodging a constitutional complaint a party must submit a copy of the contested decision .
The relevant parts of the DATE LAW on ORG ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON ) provides as follows :
“ By the decision granting a claim , the impugned decision that violated a constitutional right is quashed and the case is remitted to the competent body for retrial . ”
